titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the George Schlesinger collection of Cadman Plaza parade photographs 2000.009
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:17:24 +0000.

did.unittitle: George Schlesinger collection of Cadman Plaza parade photographs
did.abstract: Nine black-and-white photographic prints of a parade at Cadman Plaza, Brooklyn in 1939.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Nine black-and-white photographic prints of a parade at Cadman Plaza, Brooklyn in 1939. Various youth organizations are visible in the photographs, including Boy Scouts. Tracks of the elevated railroad are also visible. The photographs were owned by George Schlesinger. The identity of the photographer is unknown.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); George Schlesinger collection of Cadman Plaza parade photographs, 2000.009, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Photographs will enter the public domain in 2059.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.
